title.narrative: ECD AS A PATH TOWARDS SOCIAL INCLUSION

description.narrative: Education, health and protection policies improved and budgeted for to support social inclusion of children in early years, especially those with vulnerable backgrounds, such as Roma., which contributes to Access To Justice, Cross-Sectoral Early Childhood Development, Early Childhood Development, Early Learning, Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: OUTCOME 2 - Child wellbeing data collection and management infrastructure in 12 Child Rights Units and 12 Child Rights Observatories fully established and 50 people trained, with a special focus on capturing social exclusion and marginalization (RKLA 8)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Education, health and protection policies improved and budgeted for to support social inclusion of children in early years,especially those with vulnerable backgrounds, such as Roma.

description.narrative: In 2016, UNICEF assisted Albania&39;s Ministry of Education and Sports (MoES) in developing a comprehensive Early Learning and Development policy package; introducing Inclusive Education techniques in classroom management; enrolling Roma children in kindergartens and primary schools; and monitoring and addressing school drop-out. | Status:Met | As-of Date:30/12/2016

title.narrative: estimated % of vulnerable families with children aged 0-6 benefitting from parenting education programs

baseline.value: --- No national parenting program available in the mother and child health centres and creches

target.value: 2014:At least 30% of parents benefit from structured ECD information

actual.value: 2016:a) The positive parenting manual has been used nationally, b) the draft National Action Plan (Agenda) for Children 2016-2020 mainstreams parenting programme among all sectorial components, 3) the approved ELDS incorporate components of parents education

title.narrative: in target areas, % of vulnerable children (including Roma) NOT yet reached by early inclusive education measures

baseline.value: 52% (74% for Roma children) for the age group 3-5

target.value: 2016:Not more than 20% (45% for Roma children) for the age group 3-5

actual.value: 2016:29 percentage points increase in the inclusion of Roma children in pre-school education.

title.narrative: national approach to ECD policies (including the age group of 0-3 and taking into particular consideration the needs of most vulnerable children) is articulated

baseline.value: No coordinated policies and budgets for Early Childhood Development

target.value: 2014:Multisectorial polices on ECD and early inclusion are part of the new Social inclusion and Protection strategy (2013-2020) and other national frameworks

actual.value: 2017:Integrated approaches to ECD are included in the draft National Action Plan (Agenda) for Children 2016-2020

title.narrative: Pre-University Education law and respective policies incorporate the principle (and measurable targets) of a child friendly and inclusive school

baseline.value: Pre-University Education Law (2012) incorporates these principles in general terms

target.value: 2016:Respective targets, accountabilities and implementation mechanisms developed

actual.value: 2016:1) Inclusive Teacher profile and training programmes, 2) School based training manual for preventing drop-out, 3) Inter-sectorial guidelines to monitoring and integrate out of school children have been endorsed by MoES

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) c2a. Early learning policy and early learning programme including quality early learning curriculum and standards - score (1-4), see guidance

baseline.value: Pre-University Education Strategy defines actions for early learning

target.value: 2016:Endorsement of early learning and development standards

actual.value: 2017:Early learning and development standards have been endorsed by Minister of Education and Sports

title.narrative: political commitment and accountability for developing a comprehensive national approach to ECD is reflected in national strategies and MoES' workplans

baseline.value: Pre-University Education Strategy sets a commitment that the pre-primary year will be accessible for all children of 5 years of age (effective by 2018)

actual.value: 2016:The National Development and Integration Strategy until 2020 and National Policy Paper for Social Inclusion until 2019 identify concrete objectives and results targets for ECD
